bugs.title: CVE-2022-39282 freerdp: clients using `/parallel` command line switch might read uninitialized data

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39282 freerdp: clients using `/parallel` command line switch might read uninitialized data

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP based clients on unix systems using `/parallel` command line switch might read uninitialized data and send it to the server the client is currently connected to.

Reference:

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-c45q-wcpg-mxjq

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2134714]


Created freerdp1.2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2134715]
Reference: https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/releases/tag/2.8.1

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:2851 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2851

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-39282

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39283 freerdp: clients using the `/video` command line switch might read uninitialized data

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39283 freerdp: clients using the `/video` command line switch might read uninitialized data

long_desc.thetext:
All FreeRDP based clients when using the `/video` command line switch might read uninitialized data, decode it as audio/video and display the result.

Reference:

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-6cf9-3328-qrvh

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2134718]


Created freerdp1.2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2134719]
Reference: https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/releases/tag/2.8.1

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:2851 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2851

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-39283

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39316 freerdp: out of bounds read in zgfx decoder

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39316 freerdp: out of bounds read in zgfx decoder

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. In affected versions there is an out of bound read in ZGFX decoder component of FreeRDP. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and try to decode it likely resulting in a crash. This issue has been addressed in the 2.9.0 release. Users are advised to upgrade. 

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-5w4j-mrrh-jjrm

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143651]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2143652]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2143653]


Created freerdp1.2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2143650]

Upstream Commit:
https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/commit/e865c24efc40ebc52e75979c94cdd4ee2c1495b0

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:2851 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2851

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-39316

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39317 freerdp: undefined behaviour in zgfx decoder

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39317 freerdp: undefined behaviour in zgfx decoder

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing a range check for input offset index in ZGFX decoder. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and try to decode it. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-99cm-4gw7-c8jh

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143655]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2143656]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2143657]

Upstream Commit:
https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/commit/e865c24efc40ebc52e75979c94cdd4ee2c1495b0

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:2851 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2851

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-39317

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39318 freerdp: division by zero in urbdrc channel

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39318 freerdp: division by zero in urbdrc channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing input validation in `urbdrc` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to crash with division by zero. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0. All users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-387j-8j96-7q35

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143664]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2143669]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39319 freerdp: missing length validation in urbdrc channel

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39319 freerdp: missing length validation in urbdrc channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing input length validation in the `urbdrc` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-mvxm-wfj2-5fvh

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39320 freerdp: heap buffer overflow in urbdrc channel

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39320 freerdp: heap buffer overflow in urbdrc channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP may attempt integer addition on too narrow types leads to allocation of a buffer too small holding the data written. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-qfq2-82qr-7f4j

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143659]

Upstream commit:

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39347 freerdp: missing path sanitation with `drive` channel

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39347 freerdp: missing path sanitation with `drive` channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing path canonicalization and base path check for `drive` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read files outside the shared directory. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/drive`, `/drives` or `+home-drive` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-c5xq-8v35-pffg

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143666]

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41877 freerdp: missing input length validation in `drive` channel

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41877 freerdp: missing input length validation in `drive` channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing input length validation in `drive` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the drive redirection channel - command line options `/drive`, `+drives` or `+home-drive`.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-pmv3-wpw4-pw5h

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39317 freerdp: undefined behaviour in zgfx decoder [fedora-36]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39317 freerdp: undefined behaviour in zgfx decoder [fedora-36]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-39317 freerdp: undefined behaviour in zgfx decoder

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing a range check for input offset index in ZGFX decoder. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and try to decode it. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-99cm-4gw7-c8jh

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39320 freerdp: heap buffer overflow in urbdrc channel [fedora-36]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39320 freerdp: heap buffer overflow in urbdrc channel [fedora-36]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-39320 freerdp: heap buffer overflow in urbdrc channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP may attempt integer addition on too narrow types leads to allocation of a buffer too small holding the data written. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-qfq2-82qr-7f4j

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143659]

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/commit/68c6a8c1878b5294aecb04d5e27531a720b3793f

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:2326 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2326

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:2851 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:2851

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39318 freerdp: division by zero in urbdrc channel [fedora-36]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39318 freerdp: division by zero in urbdrc channel [fedora-36]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-39318 freerdp: division by zero in urbdrc channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing input validation in `urbdrc` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to crash with division by zero. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0. All users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-387j-8j96-7q35

bugs.title: CVE-2022-39347 freerdp: missing path sanitation with `drive` channel [fedora-36]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-39347 freerdp: missing path sanitation with `drive` channel [fedora-36]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-39347 freerdp: missing path sanitation with `drive` channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing path canonicalization and base path check for `drive` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read files outside the shared directory. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/drive`, `/drives` or `+home-drive` redirection switch.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-c5xq-8v35-pffg

Created freerdp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2143666]

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41877 freerdp: missing input length validation in `drive` channel [fedora-36]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41877 freerdp: missing input length validation in `drive` channel [fedora-36]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41877 freerdp: missing input length validation in `drive` channel

long_desc.thetext:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing input length validation in `drive` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the drive redirection channel - command line options `/drive`, `+drives` or `+home-drive`.

https://github.com/FreeRDP/FreeRDP/security/advisories/GHSA-pmv3-wpw4-pw5h
